comments.body: Is this needed? I don't think these changes require 3.6, so it would be nice to keep the TypeScript version low to keep supporting people using those versions.

It throws `'new' expression, whose target lacks a construct signature, implicitly has an 'any' type.` on older Typescript version.

https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-3-6.html#ambient-classes-and-functions-can-merge

The ambient merging feature is highly readable to me but also, I'm not sure how else I would define the type of a callable class like this without manually adding a bunch of prototype methods - is poly-filling the merge feature of 3.6 worth it?

I'd be inclined to say no but if this type def ought to continue supporting v2, I can make a new commit (suggestions would be welcomed).
I don't see any problem here with newer syntax and it is still possible to use older version of @types/bunyan-format if anyone is locked with older version of Typescript.
@PranavSenthilnathan can you weigh in here? I'd like to get this wrapped up
